label: hydrographic feature
definition: A geographical feature associated with water.

label: ocean
definition: A marine water body which is constitutes the majority of an astronomical body's hydrosphere.

label: sea
definition: A large expanse of saline water usually connected with an ocean.

label: lake
definition: A body of water or other liquid of considerable size contained in a depression on a landmass.

label: freshwater lake
definition: A lake of whose water contains low concentrations of salts.

label: stream
definition: A watercourse which is linear and flows across the solid portion of a planetary surface.

label: watercourse
definition: A flowing body of water.

label: fjord
definition: A long and narrow sea inlet with high steeply sloped walled sides. A fjord is a landform created during a period of glaciation.

label: peatland
definition: A wetland ecosystem which accumulates acidic peat, a deposit of dead plant material.

label: estuary
definition: A semi-enclosed coastal body of water with one or more rivers or streams flowing into it, and with a free connection to the open sea.

label: underground lake
definition: A lake which is formed under the surface of the Earth. Such a lake may be associated with caves and aquifers and springs.

label: underground water body
definition: A geographical feature associated with water that is under the surface of the earth.

label: water body
definition: An accumulation of water of varying size.

label: cave
definition: Naturally formed, subterranean open area or chamber.

label: mountain range
definition: A series of connected and aligned mountains or mountain ridges.

label: mountain
definition: A landform that extends above the surrounding terrain in a limited area.

label: mountain pass
definition: A lower point that allows easier access through a mountain range. A pass has the general form of a saddle between two mountains.

label: alpine glacier
definition: A glacier contained in the site of a mountain valley.

label: cliff
definition: A slope which is part of a rocky elevation and which has a high degree of steepness.

label: sea cliff
definition: A cliff that is a margin of a sea or ocean.

label: desert area
definition: A region rendered barren or partially barren by environmental extremes, especially by low rainfall.

label: island
definition: Area of dry or relatively dry land surrounded by water or low wetland.

label: valley
definition: A depression which has been formed as a result of erosion by water or ice and which is low-lying, bordered by higher ground, and especially elongate.

label: area of tundra
definition: A vegetated area which is part of a tundra ecosystem.

label: glacial feature
definition: A hydrographic feature characterized by the dominance of snow or ice.

label: ice sheet
definition: A glacier which covers an area of greater than 50,000 square kilometers.

label: glacier
definition: An ice mass which is of sufficient mass that the action of gravity upon it overcomes the frictional forces holding it in place, causing it to deform and flow towards lower elevation.

label: permafrost
definition: Soil or rock and included ice or organic material at or below the freezing point of water (0 degrees Celsius or 32 degrees Fahrenheit) for two or more years.

label: coastal inlet
definition: An opening of the sea into the land.

label: bank
definition: The sloping margin of a watercourse, serving to confine it to its natural channel.

label: ice cap
definition: A dome-shaped ice mass that covers less than 50,000 km2 of land area (usually covering a highland area).

label: snow field
definition: A region of permanent snow in mountainous areas or high latitudes.

label: cirque
definition: A depression which is semicircular or crescent-shaped, found towards the crest of a mountain, and formed by the erosional processes caused by the motion of a glacier.

label: isthmus
definition: Narrow section of land in a body of water connecting two larger land areas.

label: elevation
definition: A landform elevated above the surrounding area.

label: moraine
definition: An accumulation of boulders, stones, or other debris carried and deposited by a glacier.

label: nunatak
definition: The exposed summit of a ridge, mountain, or peak not covered with ice or snow within an ice field or glacier. The term is typically used in areas where a permanent ice mass is present.

label: plateau
definition: An elevated and comparatively level expanse of land.

label: hanging valley
definition: A tributary valley with the floor at a higher relief than the main channel into which it flows. They are most commonly associated with U-shaped valleys when a tributary glacier flows into a glacier of larger volume.

label: tundra mire
definition: Peatlands with a shallow peat layer, only about 500 mm thick, dominated by sedges and grasses. They form in permafrost areas, covering around 110,000 to 160,000 km2 in Alaska, Canada, and the former USSR.

label: solid astronomical body part
definition: A part of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of a continuous volume of solid material, shaped by one or more environmental processes.

label: ice-covered lake
definition: A lake permanently covered by ice.

label: periglacial lake
definition: A lake, part of whose margin is formed by an ice mass, ice cap or glacier, the ice having obstructed the natural drainage of the land.

label: fjord lake
definition: A lake in a glacially eroded valley, which has been eroded below sea level.

label: marine neritic zone
definition: The water mass of an ocean directly above a continental shelf.

label: oceanic zone
definition: The water mass of an ocean that is not above a continental shelf.

label: marine pelagic zone
definition: An open ocean region.

label: marine photic zone
definition: The zone of an ocean from the surface to where photosynthesis can occur, due to the penetration of light.

label: marine aphotic zone
definition: The zone of an ocean below 200m, in which photosynthesis cannot occur due to the lack of light.

label: continental shelf
definition: A slope which a) extends the perimeter of a continent, b) is covered by a shallow marine water body during interglacial periods, c) has a low degree of steepness relative to a continental slope or rise.

label: coastal wetland ecosystem
definition: A wetland ecosystem which overlaps both terrestrial and marine ecosystems.

label: glacial valley
definition: A valley that contains, or contained, a glacier and was formed by glacial activity. Typically U-shaped in cross-section.

label: lateral moraine
definition: The parallel ridges of till deposited along the sides of an alglacier. The unconsolidated debris is deposited on top of the glacier by frost shattering of the valley walls and from tributary streams flowing into the valley. The till is carried along the glacial margin until the glacier melts.

label: medial moraine
definition: A moriane formed when the inside lateral moraines of two glaciers merge together. They form a ridge down the center of the combined glaciers.

label: ground moraine
definition: A till covered area with irregular topography and no ridges, often forming gently rolling hills or plains. Forms by the accumulation of till under the ice by lodgement, but may also be deposited as the glacier retreats.

label: terminal moraine
definition: Ridges of unconsolidated debris deposited at the snout or end of the glacier. They usually reflect the shape of the glacier's terminus.

label: continental slope
definition: A slope which 1) is part of the seafloor and 2) extends from the end of the continental shelf (the shelf break) to the continental rise.

label: ridge
definition: A long and narrow elevation with steep sides.

label: marine iceberg
definition: A large mass of detached land ice in the sea or stranded in shallow water.

label: ice field
definition: A field of ice, formed in regions of perennial frost.

label: sea coast
definition: The general region of indefinite width that extends from the sea inland to the first major change in terrain features.

label: shore
definition: That part of the land in immediate contact with a body of water including the area between high and low water lines.

label: icefall
definition: A portion of a glacier characterized by rapid flow, a chaotic crevassed surface, and a pronounced, at times vertical, slope.

label: depression
definition: A landform sunken or depressed below the surrounding area.

label: crevasse
definition: A deep fissure in snow or ice.

label: vadose zone
definition: A zone beneath the land surface and above the level of permanent groundwater or phreatic zone in which water has a hydraulic head less than atmospheric pressure and is retained by a combination of adhesion and capillary action.

label: phreatic zone
definition: A compound astronomical body part which is located beneath the land surface and in which all interstices are filled with water that has a hydraulic head greater than atmospheric pressure due to the weight of overlying groundwater.

label: ice cap dome
definition: A comparatively elevated area on an icecap.

label: area of protected biodiversity
definition: An area of land or of a body of water in which management practices,  through legal or other effective means, prioritise the protection and maintenance of biological diversity, and of natural and associated cultural resources.

label: brine pool
definition:
MERGED DEFINITION:
TARGET DEFINITION: A large area of brine on the ocean basin near cold seep vents which release methane into the water. These pools are concentrations of water having an extremely high salinity as compared to the surrounding ocean, caused by the motion of large salt deposits through salt tectonics.

SOURCE DEFINITION: Marine brine pools are large areas of brine on the ocean basin. These pools are bodies of water that have a salinity three to five times greater than the surrounding ocean. For deep-sea brine pools the source of the salt is the dissolution of large salt deposits through salt tectonics. The brine often contains high concentrations of methane, providing energy to chemosynthetic animals that live near the pool.

label: ice shelf
definition: An ice mass which 1) is attached to the coast 2) at least 2 meters in thickness 3) forms where a glacier or ice mass flows down to a coastline and onto the ocean surface and 4) grows by annual snow accumulation or by the seaward extension of land glaciers.

label: stream mouth
definition: The place where a stream discharges into a lagoon, lake, or the sea.

label: ice tongue
definition: A long and narrow sheet of ice projecting out from the coastline. An ice tongue forms when a valley glacier moves very rapidly out into the ocean or a lake.

label: sound
definition: A large sea or ocean inlet larger than a bay, deeper than a bight, wider than a fjord, or it may identify a narrow sea or ocean channel between two bodies of land.

label: strait
definition: A narrow channel of water that connects two larger bodies of water, and thus lies between two land masses.

label: channel of a watercourse
definition: The physical confine of a river, slough or ocean strait consisting of a bed and banks.

label: pingo
definition: A mound of earth-covered ice found in the Arctic, subarctic, and Antarctica that can reach up to 70 metres in height and up to 2 kilometres in diameter.

label: biome
definition: A biome is an ecosystem to which resident ecological communities have evolved adaptations.

label: dirt cone
definition: A feature of a glacier, in which dirt, which has fallen into a hollow in the ice, forms a coating which insulates the ice below. The surrounding ice melts away, leaving the dirt cone.

label: proglacial lake
definition: A lake formed either by the damming action of a moraine or ice dam during the retreat of a melting glacier, or one formed by meltwater trapped against an ice mass due to isostatic depression of the crust around the ice.

label: tunnel valley
definition: A deep but narrow valley with a 'U' shaped cross-section and frequently a 'U' shaped plan which is usually found filled with glacial till. It is formed when the edge of an ice mass advances up a slope. Its length may be appropriately measured in centimetres or kilometres, depending on the circumstances of formation.

label: terrestrial biome
definition: A biome which is  primarily or completely situated on a landmass.

label: marine biome
definition: An aquatic biome which is determined by a marine water body.

label: tarn
definition: A mountain lake that is formed in a cirque excavated by a glacier. A moraine may form a natural dam below a tarn.

label: tidewater glacier
definition: A glacier which terminates in a lake or the sea, with terminus either floating or grounded

label: plateau glacier
definition: A glacier on a plateau or high area, smaller than an ice sheet.

label: valley glacier
definition: A glacier which 1) flows for all or most of its length within the walls of a valley, in consequence having a distinct tongue and a well-defined outline and 2) descends from either high mountains, from an ice cap on a plateau, or from an ice sheet.

label: outlet glacier
definition: A glacier fed by an ice sheet.

label: harbor
definition: A place where ships may shelter from the weather or are stored.

label: artificial harbor
definition: A harbor constructed by human agency.

label: natural harbor
definition: A harbor which is formed by a natural landform where a part of a body of water is protected and deep enough to furnish anchorage.

label: inlet
definition: An opening of the sea into the land, or of a lake into its shore.

label: lake inlet
definition: An opening of a lake into its shore.

label: mount
definition: A mountain or a hill.

label: mouth
definition: The exit or point of discharge of a stream into another stream, lake or sea.

label: peak
definition: The summit of a mount.

label: sea floor
definition: The ground surface that lies beneath a sea.

label: polynya
definition: Any enclosed water area in pack ice other than a lead, not large enough to be called open water. When frozen over, a polyna becomes an ice skylight from the point of view of the submariner.

label: paternoster lake
definition: One of a series of glacial lakes connected by a single stream or a braided stream system.

label: glacial lake
definition: A lake which is primarily composed of glacial meltwater and which fills a depression formed as a result of a glacial erosion process.

label: submerged bed
definition: The portion of the ground surface which lies below water.

label: crater
definition: A generally circular saucer or bowl-shaped depression caused by volcanic or meteorite explosive action.

label: hummock
definition: A patch of ground, distinct from and slightly above the surrounding plain or wetland. Often occurs in groups.

label: ice cap ridge
definition: A linear elevation on an icecap.

label: ice cap depression
definition: A depression which is part of an ice cap.

label: freshwater biome
definition: An aquatic biome which is determined by a body of freshwater.

label: rock
definition: A rock is a naturally occurring solid aggregate of one or more minerals or mineraloids.

label: soil
definition: Soil is an environmental material which is primarily composed of minerals, varying proportions of sand, silt, and clay, organic material such as humus, gases, liquids, and a broad range of resident micro- and macroorganisms.

label: marine water body
definition: A significant accumulation of water which is part of a marine biome.

label: slope
definition: A solid astronomical body part which is part of the planetary surface between the peak of an elevation or the bottom of a depression and  relatively flat surrounding land.

label: air
definition: The mixture of gases (roughly (by molar content/volume: 78% nitrogen, 20.95% oxygen, 0.93% argon, 0.038% carbon dioxide, trace amounts of other gases, and a variable amount (average around 1%) of water vapor) that surrounds the planet Earth.

label: liquid water
definition: An environmental material primarily composed of dihydrogen oxide in its liquid form.

label: sediment
definition: Sediment is an environmental substance comprised of any particulate matter that can be transported by fluid flow and which eventually is deposited as a layer of solid particles on the bedor bottom of a body of water or other liquid.

label: dust
definition: Minute solid particles with diameters less than 500 micrometers. Occurs in and may be deposited from, the atmosphere.

label: saline water
definition: Water which contains a significant concentration of dissolved salts.

label: fresh water
definition: Water which has a low concentration of dissolved solutes, particularly that of sodium chloride.

label: hypersaline water
definition: Water which contains a highly increased concentration of dissolved salts, surpassing the average salinity of seawater.

label: brackish water
definition: Water which has a higher salinity than fresh water but a lower salinity than marine water.

label: aquatic biome
definition: A biome which is determined by a water body and which has ecological climax communities adapted to life in or on water.

label: anaerobic sediment
definition: Sediment characterised by the absence of oxygen.

label: deep marine sediment
definition: Sediment that accumulates in the flat or very gently sloping areas of the deep ocean basin floor. The three main types of deep marine sediment, also known as pelagic sediment, are siliceous oozes, calcareous oozes, and red clays.

label: contaminated soil
definition: A portion of contaminated soil is a portion of soil with elevated levels of some contaminant.

label: cave wall
definition: A solid surface layer which 1)  forms part of the boundary between the cavity of a cave and its solid container and 2) is roughtly perpendicular to the cave floor.

label: sea water
definition: Water which has physicochemical properties that have been determined by the processes occuring in a sea or ocean.

label: coastal sea water
definition: Coastal sea water is sea water that is adjacent to a coast.

label: sea ice
definition: Water ice which has formed by the freezing of sea water.

label: cryosol
definition: Cryosols comprise mineral soils formed in a permafrost environment. Where water is present, it occurs primarily in the form of ice. Cryogenic processes are the dominant soil-forming processes.

label: thermocline
definition: A cline across which temperature changes rapidly.

label: chemocline
definition: A cline across which the chemical composition of a fluid changes rapidly.

label: environmental feature
definition: A material entity which determines an environmental system.

label: ocean basin
definition: A structural basin that is below sea level.

label: clay
definition: A group of hydrous aluminium phyllosilicate (phyllosilicates being a subgroup of silicate minerals) minerals (see clay minerals), that are typically less than 2 micrometres in diameter. Clay consists of a variety of phyllosilicate minerals rich in silicon and aluminium oxides and hydroxides which include variable amounts of structural water.

label: brine
definition: Water saturated or nearly saturated with salt (NaCl).

label: enriched soil
definition: A portion of enriched soil is a portion of soil with elevated levels of some material entity.

label: underground water
definition: Water which has physicochemical properties determined by processes which occur beneath the planetary crust.

label: marine mud
definition: Mud which is part of a marine ecosystem.

label: ice rise
definition: An ice rise is an elevation which is part of an ice shelf, typically dome shared, and formed by the ice shelf overriding an obstruction in the seabed. An ice rise may be adjacent only to an ice shelf, or to an ice shelf and a sea. For some features, properly ice rises, the term island has become established through usage.

label: ice piedmont
definition: A glacier covering a coastal strip of low-lying land backed by mountains, and sloping gently seaward over a distance up to 30km or more to terminate in ice cliffs or to merge with an ice shelf.

label: strand crack
definition: Fissure at the junction between an inland ice sheet, ice piedmont or ice rise and an ice shelf, the latter being subject to the rise and fall of the tide.

label: environmental material
definition: A portion of environmental material is a fiat object part which forms the medium or part of the medium of an environmental system.

label: surface layer
definition: A layer of some material entity which is adjacent to one or more of its external boundaries and directly interacts with its immediate surroundings.

label: aerosol
definition: Airborne solid particles (also called dust or particulate matter (PM)) or liquid droplets.

label: aquifer
definition: An underground layer of water-bearing permeable rock or unconsolidated materials (gravel, sand, silt, or clay) from which groundwater can be usefully extracted using a water well.

label: mud
definition: A liquid or semi-liquid mixture of water and some combination of soil, silt, and clay.

label: organic object formed through microbial activity
definition: An organic object which is formed as a result of the biological processes mediated by microbial assemblages.

label: silt
definition: Silt is granular material of a size somewhere between sand and clay whose mineral origin is quartz and feldspar.

label: sand
definition: A naturally occurring granular material composed of finely divided rock and mineral particles.

label: cave floor
definition: A solid surface layer which 1) forms part of the boundary between the cavity of a cave and its solid container and 2)  is the closest solid boundary to the gravitational centre of the astronomical body of which the cave is a part.

label: marine pelagic biome
definition: The marine pelagic biome (pelagic meaning open sea) is that of the marine water column, from the surface to the greatest depths.

label: marine benthic biome
definition: The marine benthic biome (benthic meaning 'bottom') encompasses the seafloor and includes such areas as shores, littoral or intertidal areas, marine coral reefs, and the deep seabed.

label: marine neritic benthic zone biome
definition: The marine neritic zone biome comprises sea floor from the high tide mark to a continental shelf break. This zone generally extends to 200 m below average sea level.

label: marine pelagic feature
definition: A prominent or distinctive aspect, quality, or characteristic of environments occurring within the marine water column.

label: ocean biome
definition: A marine biome which is determined by an ocean.

label: marine algal bloom
definition: A marine algal bloom is a rapid increase or accumulation in the population of algae in a marine system. Typically, only one or a small number of phytoplankton  species are involved. Although there is no officially recognized threshold level, algae can be considered to be blooming at concentrations of hundreds to thousands of cells per milliliter, depending on the severity.

label: particulate matter
definition: Particulate material is an environmental material which is composed of microscopic portions of solid or liquid material suspended in another environmental material.

label: marine wind mixed layer
definition: The upper part of the marine water column with generally uniform properties resulting from wind-driven mixing.

label: planktonic material
definition: A portion of planktonic material is a portion of environmental material primarily composed of plankton.

label: marine oxygen minimum zone
definition: A marine water mass which is characterized by having much lower than normal dissolved oxygen concentrations persistently.

label: marine anoxic zone
definition: Marine anoxic zones are areas of marine water that are depleted of dissolved oxygen. This condition is generally found in areas that have restricted water exchange. In most cases, oxygen is prevented from reaching the deeper levels by a physical barrier (sill) as well as by a pronounced density stratification. Anoxic conditions will occur if the rate of oxidation of organic matter by bacteria is greater than the supply of dissolved oxygen.

label: marine current
definition: A water current which is maintained by a continuous, directed movement of marine water, generated by forces caused by breaking waves, wind, Coriolis force, temperature and salinity differences, and tides caused by the gravitational pull of astronomical bodies. Depth contours, shoreline configurations and interaction with other currents influence a current's direction and strength.

label: marine thermocline
definition: A thermocline which is part of a marine water body.

label: marine chemocline
definition: A marine chemocline is a marine cline caused by a strong, vertical chemistry gradient within a body of marine water. Chemoclines most commonly occur where local conditions favor the formations of anoxic bottom water.

label: marine pycnocline
definition: A pycnocline which is part of a marine water body and composed primarily of sea water.

label: marine nutricline
definition: A nutricline which is part of a marine water body.

label: marine lysocline
definition: The marine lysocline denotes the depth in the ocean below which the rate of dissolution of calcite increases dramatically. As water column depth and therefore pressure increases, the corresponding calcite saturation of seawater decreases and the calcite begins dissolve.

label: pelagic isothermal surface
definition: A roughly planar, pelagic region characterised by equal water temperature.

label: pelagic isohaline surface
definition: A roughly planar, pelagic region characterised by equal salinity.

label: biogenous sediment
definition: Biogenous sediment is derived from living organisms, typically planktonic organisms possessing shells, frustules or coccoliths.

label: pelagic isopycnal surface
definition: A roughly planar, pelagic region characterised by equal water density.

label: permanent marine thermocline
definition: A marine thermocline which separates the marine cold-water sphere from the marine warm-water sphere and which does not dissipate seasonally.

label: seasonal marine thermocline
definition: A marine thermocline which is present below the marine wind mixed layer.

label: marine cold-water sphere
definition: The marine cold-water sphere describes a water mass extending from the polar seas and across low latitudes at depths of ca. 800 to 1000 m, which is separated from the marine warm-water sphere by the permanent marine thermocline

label: marine warm-water sphere
definition: The marine warm-water sphere describes a water mass extending to depths of ca. 800 to 1000 m in low and middle latitudes. It is separated from the marine cold-water sphere by the permanent marine thermocline

label: nitrate-reducing sediment
definition: Sediment hosting and characterised by active nitrate reducing microbial communities.

label: manganese-reducing sediment
definition: Sediment hosting and characterised by active manganese reducing microbial communities.

label: iron-reducing sediment
definition: Sediment hosting and characterised by active iron reducing microbial communities.

label: sulphate-reducing sediment
definition: Sediment hosting and characterised by active sulphate reducing microbial communities.

label: carbon dioxide-reducing sediment
definition: Sediment hosting and characterised by active carbon dioxide reducing microbial communities.

label: organic material
definition: Environmental material derived from living organisms and composed primarily of one or more biomacromolecules.

label: microbial mat material
definition: Material derived from a microbial mat, a multi-layered sheet of micro-organisms, mainly bacteria and archaea. Microbial mats create a wide range of internal chemical environments.

label: marine snow
definition: Marine snow is a continuous shower of mostly organic detritus falling from the upper layers of the water column. Its origin lies in activities within the productive photic zone.

label: marine pockmark
definition: Pockmarks are craters in the seabed resulting from the release of gas or liquid. Generally, they are formed in soft, fine-grained seabed sediments by the escape of fluids (gas or water, but mainly methane) into the water column.

label: desert biome
definition: A desert biome is a terrestrial biome which loses more liquid water by evapotranspiration than is supplied by precipitation and includes communities adapted to these conditions.

label: tundra biome
definition: A terrestrial biome which comprises a tundra ecosystem that has reached its climax community.

label: polar desert biome
definition: A polar desert biome is a desert biome which is subject to low levels of insolation, annual precipitation less than 250 millimeters, and a mean temperature less than 10 degrees Celsius during its warmest month. Temperature changes in polar deserts frequently cross the freezing point of water.

label: broadleaf forest biome
definition: A broadleaf forest in which dominant ecological communities have reached their climax successional state.

label: environmental condition
definition: An environmental condition is a range of a determinate quality or combination of qualities that are present in an environmental system.

label: arid
definition: An environmental condition in which annual precipitation is less than half of annual potential evapotranspiration.

label: polar
definition: A polar condition is an environmental condition in which an environmental system receives low, yearly solar irradiance per unit area, resulting in colder climatic conditions.

label: subpolar
definition: A subpolar condition is an environmental condition in which an environmental system receives low, yearly solar irradiance per unit area and is surrounded by large land masses. This results in very cold winters with temperatures potentially falling to around -40 degrees Celsius and summers which last no more than 3 months of the year with a 24-hour average temperature of at least 10 degrees Celsius.

label: environmental system
definition: A system which has the disposition to environ one or more material entities.

label: mineral material
definition: A mineral material is an environmental material which is primarily composed of some substance that is naturally occurring, solid and stable at room temperature, representable by a chemical formula, usually abiogenic, and that has an ordered atomic structure.

label: fluid cline
definition: A fluid front which is 1) thin in comparison to the fluid mass it is a part of and 2) across which a property of that fluid mass varies greatly over short vertical distance, relative to variation across the entire fluid mass.

label: pycnocline
definition: A cline across which the density of a fluid changes rapidly.

label: water vapour
definition: Water vapour is a vapour which is the gas phase of water.

label: atmosphere
definition: An atmosphere is a layer of gases surrounding a material body of sufficient mass that is held in place by the gravity of the body.

label: atmospheric water vapour
definition: Atmospheric water vapour is water vapour that is part of an atmosphere.

label: structural basin
definition: A structural basin is a geological depression formed by tectonic warping of previously flat lying rock strata.

label: ecoregion
definition: A large unit of land or water containing a geographically distinct assemblage of species, natural communities, and environmental conditions.

label: water ice
definition: Ice is water frozen into a solid state. It can appear transparent or opaque bluish-white color, depending on the presence of impurities or air inclusions. The addition of other materials such as soil may further alter its appearance.

label: ice lens
definition: An ice mass which is formed when moisture, diffused within soil or rock, accumulates and freezes in a localized zone, wedging soil or rock apart.

label: ecozone
definition: Ecozones delineate large areas of a planetary surface within which organisms have been evolving in relative isolation over long periods of time, separated from one another by geographic features, such as oceans, broad deserts, or high mountain ranges, that constitute barriers to migration.

label: layer
definition: A layer is a quantity of some material which is spatially continuous, has comparable thickness, and usually covers some surface.

label: lake layer
definition: A layer which is part of a lake.

label: ice mass
definition: A mass of water ice.

label: marine layer
definition: A layer that is part of a marine water body.

label: continental margin
definition: A slope which is part of the seafloor, descends from the continental crust to the oceanic crust, and comprises the continental shelf, continental slope, and continental rise.

label: estuarine water
definition: Brackish water which is part of an estuary.

label: freshwater environment
definition: An aquatic environment which is determined by freshwater.

label: saline water environment
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by saline water.

label: cold environment
definition: An environment which has a lower temperature than some local or global average.

label: aquatic environment
definition: An environment whose dynamics are strongly influenced by water.

label: marine environment
definition: A marine environment and enviroment which is determined by a marine water body.

label: sea water environment
definition: An environmental system determined by seawater.

label: brackish water environment
definition: An environment determined by the presence of brackish water.

label: atmospheric boundary layer
definition: The atmospheric boundary layer is the lowest layer of an atmosphere which is strongly influenced by its contact with a planetary surface with strong vertical mixing and in which physical quantities such as flow velocity, temperature, and moisture display rapid fluctuations (turbulence).

label: planetary surface
definition: A planetary surface is a surface layer where the solid or liquid material of a planet comes into contact with an atmosphere or outer space.

label: aquatic layer
definition: A layer in a water mass, itself composed primarily of water.

label: deep chlorophyll maximum layer
definition: A subsurface layer in a water body, typically an ocean or lake, in which chlorophyll concentrations reach their maximum.

label: polar biome
definition: A biome which is subject to polar climatic conditions.

label: alpine
definition: An altitudinal condition which inheres in a bearer by virtue of the bearer having a monthly mean temperature is less than 10 degrees Celsius and being located at altitudes above the tree line and below the snowline.

label: subalpine
definition: An altitudinal condition which inheres in a bearer by virtue of the bearer being located at an altitude immediately below the tree line of an elevation.

label: montane
definition: An altitudinal condition which inheres in a bearer by virtue of the bearer being located at an altitude between mid-altitude forests and the tree line.

label: altitudinal condition
definition: An altitudinal condition is an environmental condition in which ranges of factors such as temperature, humidity, soil composition, solar irradiation, and tree density vary with ranges in altitude.

label: nival
definition: An altitudinal condition which inheres in a bearer by virtue of the bearer having extremely limited vegetation cover, silica-enriched soils, and ground cover dominated by snow and ice at altitudes above the snowline.

label: upper montane
definition: An upper montane condition is a montane condition in which an altitude range falls immediately below the tree line.

label: lower montane
definition: A lower montane condition is a montane condition in which an altitude range falls immediately above mid-altitude forests.

label: field
definition: An unbroken expanse (as of ice)

label: ice cap climatic condition
definition: An ice cap climatic condition is a polar condition in which the montly average temperature does not exceed 0 degrees Celsius.

label: vegetation layer
definition: A layer which is determined by a form of vegetation.

label: ice cave
definition: An ice cave is a bedrock cave which contains year-round ice formations.

label: tundra climatic condition
definition: An tundra climatic condition is a polar condition in which at least one month's average temperature exceeds 0 degrees Celsius.

label: cold desert
definition: A cold desert is a desert which has hot summers and cold, dry winters with temperatures below 0 degrees Celsius

label: manufactured plastic
definition: A (portion of) plastic is an (portion of) anthropogenic environmental material including any of numerous organic synthetic or processed materials which are primarily composed of thermoplastic or thermosetting polymers of high molecular weight.

label: snow
definition: Snow is an environmental material which is primarily composed of flakes of crystalline water ice.

label: environmental zone
definition: A site which has its extent determined by the presence or influence of one or more components of an environmental system or the processes occurring therein.

label: broadleaf forest
definition: A forest biome which contains densely packed populations or communities of broadleaf trees, strongly limiting light penetration to the forest floor.

label: disturbed ecosystem
definition: An ecosystem which has been subject to a perturbation, that is, the ecosystem has undergone a pronounced change in response to a change in environmental conditions or other perturbation.

label: atmospheric carbon dioxide
definition: Atmospheric carbon dioxide is an environmental material composed of carbon dioxide in its gaseous form present in an atmosphere.

label: troposphere
definition: The lowest of the concentric layers of the atmosphere, occurring between the Earth's surface and the tropopause. It is the zone where atmospheric turbulence is at its greatest and where the bulk of the Earth's weather is generated. It contains almost all the water vapour and aerosols and three-quarters of the total gaseous mass of the atmosphere. Throughout the troposphere temperature decreases with height at a mean rate of 6.5°C/km and the whole zone is capped by either an inversion of temperature or an isothermal layer at the tropopause. (Source: WHIT)

label: atmospheric layer
definition: A layer that is part of the atmosphere.

label: hydrocarbon gas
definition: A gas that is primarily composed of hydrocarbon molecules.

label: lentic water body
definition: A lentic water body is a water body in which the accumulated water, in its totality, has very little to no directed flow.

label: lotic water body
definition: A lotic water body is a water body in which the accumulated water, in its totality, is flowing.

label: hydrological condensation process
definition: Hydrological condensation is a process in which atmospheric water vapour undergoes a phase transition from the gas phase to the liquid phase.

label: climate change
definition: The long-term fluctuations in temperature, precipitation, wind, and all other aspects of the Earth's climate. External processes, such as solar-irradiance variations, variations of the Earth's orbital parameters (eccentricity, precession, and inclination), lithosphere motions, and volcanic activity, are factors in climatic variation. Internal variations of the climate system, e.g., changes in the abundance of greenhouse gases, also may produce fluctuations of sufficient magnitude and variability to explain observed climate change through the feedback processes interrelating the components of the climate system.

label: acidification of an aquatic environment
definition: Acidification of an aquatic environment is a process whereby the pH of an aquatic environment, biome, or water body is lowered.

label: ocean acidification
definition: Ocean acidification is a process during which the pH of a sea or ocean is lowered.

label: ecosystem-wide aerobic respiration
definition: A process which consists of all aerobic respiration processes instantiated in an ecosystem.

label: planetary landmass
definition: A landmass which is part of a planet.

label: outer space
definition: Outer space is a hard vacuum containing a low density of particles, predominantly a plasma of hydrogen and helium as well as electromagnetic radiation, magnetic fields, neutrinos, dust and cosmic rays that exists between celestial bodies.

label: planetary crust
definition: A planetary crust is the outermost solid shell of a rocky planet or natural satellite, which is chemically distinct from the underlying mantle.

label: planetary structural layer
definition: A planetary structural layer is laminar part of a terrestrial planet or other rocky body large enough to have differentiation by density. Planetary layers have differing physicochemical properties and composition.

label: lithosphere
definition: A lithosphere is the outermost shell of a terrestrial-type planet or natural satellite that is defined by its rigid mechanical properties.

label: asthenosphere
definition: An asthenosphere is a layer of a terrestrial-type planet or natural satellite which is highly viscous, mechanically weak, and ductilely deforming.

label: ocean strait
definition: An ocean strait is a strait which connects two oceans.

label: area of open water
definition: An area of a planet's surface which is primarily composed of water in contact with an atmospheric column extending from the planetary boundary layer to the planet's exosphere with little to no physical obstruction.

label: geological fracture
definition: A geological fracture is any separation in a geologic formation, such as a joint or a fault that divides a mass of rock into two or more pieces.

label: atmospheric column
definition: A vertical pillar defined by a unit area on a planetary surface and bounded by the top of the atmosphere that is used to quantify an atmospheric parameter such as pressure, ozone or precipitable water.

label: sodium chloride salt
definition: A mineral material composed primarily of sodium chloride.

label: glacial abrasion
definition: A glacial abrasion process is an erosional process during which debris in the basal ice scrapes along the bed, polishing and gouging the underlying rocks, similar to sandpaper on wood.

label: glacial plucking
definition: Glacial plucking is an erosional process during which pieces of bedrock are cracked off due to the mechanical force of a moving glacier.

label: glacial ice thrusting
definition: Glacial ice thrusting is an erosional process during which a moving glacier which has frozen to its bed surges forward and moves large sheets of sediment frozen to the glacial mass.

label: water mass
definition: A mass of water.

label: marine water mass
definition: A mass of marine water.

label: coast
definition: A coast is the area where land meets the sea, ocean, or lake.

label: mass wasting
definition: Mass wasting is the geomorphic process by which solid environmental material such as soil, sand, regolith, and/or rock move downslope typically as a mass, largely under the force of gravity, but frequently affected by water and water content as in submarine environments and mudslides.

label: avalanche
definition: A mass wasting flow during which snow rapidly flows down a sloping surface.

label: mass wasting flow
definition: A mass wasting flow is a form of mass wasting during which the moving materials behave similarly to a flowing fluid. Water, air and ice are often involved in enabling fluidlike motion of the material.

label: hydrological precipitation process
definition: Hydrological precipitation is a process during which any product of the condensation of atmospheric water vapour is pulled to the planetary surface by gravity.

label: soil erosion
definition: Soil erosion is a process in which exogenic processes remove soil from one location on the Earth's crust and transport it to another location where it is deposited.

label: snowmelt
definition: Snowmelt is a hydrological melting process in which water is produced by the melting of snow and becomes part of the hydrological surface runoff.

label: hydrological melting process
definition: A melting process during which water-based ice, snow, or other solid phase water transitions into a liquid phase.

label: icemelt
definition: Icemelt is a hydrological melthing process in which water is produced by the melting of ice and becomes part of the hydrological surface runoff.

label: meltwater
definition: Meltwater is the water released by the melting of snow or ice, including glacial ice, tabular icebergs and ice shelves over oceans.

label: melting
definition: Melting is a physical process that results in the phase transition of a substance from a solid to a liquid.

label: condensation process
definition: Condensation is a process during which a gas undergoes a phase transition into a liquid.

label: desublimation process
definition: Desublimation is a process in which a portion of some gas undergoes a phase transition into a portion of some solid.

label: sublimation process
definition: Sublimation is a process during which a portion of some solid undergoes a phase transition into a portion of some gas.

label: habitat
definition: An environmental system which can sustain and allow the growth of an ecological population.

label: area of perennial water ice
definition: An area of a planet's surface which is primarily composed of water ice, present throughout multiple years, in contact with an atmospheric column extending from the planetary boundary layer to the planet's exosphere with little to no physical obstruction.

label: carbon-bearing gas emission process
definition: A carbon emission process is any environmental process which outputs a carbon-bearing gas.

label: area of perennial ice or snow
definition: An area of a planet's surface which is primarily composed of snow or water ice, present throughout multiple years, in contact with an atmospheric column extending from the planetary boundary layer to the planet's exosphere with little to no physical obstruction.

label: continental crust
definition: A layer of igneous, sedimentary, and metamorphic rocks that forms continents and the areas of shallow seabed close to their shores, known as continental shelves.

label: oceanic crust
definition: Oceanic crust is the uppermost layer of the oceanic portion of a tectonic plate.

label: area of barren land
definition: An area of a planet's surface which is primarily composed of bedrock, desert pavement, scarp rock, talus, material exposed by slides, volcanic material, glacial debris, sand, material exposed during strip mining, gravel, and other accumulations of earthen material in contact with an atmospheric column extending from the planetary boundary layer to the planet's exosphere with little to no physical obstruction.

label: fumarole-derived ice tower
definition: A hollow tower of ice formed by the freezing of steam escaping a fumarole.

label: cloud
definition: A cloud is a visible mass of aerosolised liquid droplets or frozen crystals suspended in an atmosphere above the surface of a planetary body.

label: polar stratospheric cloud
definition: Polar stratospheric clouds are clouds which form in the winter polar stratosphere at altitudes of 15,000–25,000 metres and which support chemical reactions that produce active chlorine and remove gaseous nitric acid, catalysing ozone destruction.

label: carbon dioxide emission process
definition: A carbon emission process is any environmental process which releases carbon dioxide gas into the atmosphere.

label: key biodiversity area
definition: An environmental zone which contains, as determined by an officially mandated selection process, one or more ecosystems which include, as parts, ecological communities of global significance for conservation due to their vulnerability and irreplaceability.

label: mass gaseous flow
definition: A process whereby a large volume of gas moves due to a disequilibrium of physical forces.

label: gaseous environmental material
definition: A material entity which is composed of one or more chemical entities and has neither independent shape nor volume but tends to expand indefinitely.

label: plasma
definition: A material entity which is composed of a volume of unbound positive and negative particles in roughly equal numbers, conducts electricity, and possesses internal magnetic fields.

label: astronomical body
definition: An object which is naturally occuring, bound together by gravitational or electromagnetic forces, and surrounded by space.

label: planet
definition: A planet is an astronomical body orbiting a star or stellar remnant that is massive enough to be rounded by its own gravity, is not massive enough to cause thermonuclear fusion, and has cleared its neighbouring region of planetesimals.

label: star
definition: An astronomical object which is composed primarily of luminous plasma held in a spherical form by gravitational forces.

label: astronomical object
definition: An object which is composed of one or more gravitationally bound structures that are associated with a position in space.

label: planetary atmosphere
definition: An atmosphere which surrounds a planet.

label: nitrogen-oxygen planetary atmosphere
definition: A planetary atmosphere which is composted primarily of dinitrogen and dioxygen gas.

label: astronomical body part
definition: A material part of an astronomical body.

label: solid environmental material
definition: An environmental material which is in a solid state.

label: liquid environmental material
definition: An environmental material which is in a liquid state.

label: biosphere
definition: A biosphere is a part of an astronomical body which includes, as parts, all the living entities within the gravitational sphere of influence of that body, as well as the non-living and dead entities with which they interact.

label: cryosphere
definition: A cryosphere is that part of a planet which is primarily composed of water is in solid form.

label: hydrosphere
definition: An astronomical body part which is composed of the combined mass of water found on, under, and over the surface of a planet.

label: pedosphere
definition: An astronomical body part which is composed of soil, subject to soil formation processes, and found on the surface of a lithosphere.

label: planetary photic zone
definition: A planetary part which is exposed, at least periodically, to light.

label: illuminated biosphere part
definition: An astronomical body part which includes those parts of a biosphere that are, at least periodically, illuminated and in which photosynthesis may occur.

label: humid air
definition: Air which has increased levels of water vapour.

label: water vapour saturated air
definition: Air which has a partial pressure of water vapour equal or near equal to its equilibrium vapor pressure at a given temperature.

label: water-based rainfall
definition: A hydrological precipitation process in which atmospheric water vapour condenses to form droplets of liquid water massive enough to fall to a planetary surface due to the planet's gravity.

label: droplet
definition: A droplet is a small column of liquid, bounded completely or almost completely by free surfaces which maintains its shape due to the surface tension of the liquid.

label: raindrop
definition: A droplet formed by condensation of vapour in an atmosphere and which is sufficiently massive to overcome atmospheric resistance and fall to a planetary surface due to gravity.

label: water droplet
definition: A droplet of water

label: combustion process
definition: Combustion or burning is a high-temperature exothermic redox chemical reaction between a fuel and an oxidant that produces oxidized, often gaseous products, in a mixture termed as smoke.

label: thermolysis
definition: A chemical decomposition (the separation of a single chemical compound into its two or more elemental parts or to simpler compounds) caused by heat.

label: crystal
definition: A solid material whose constituents, such as atoms, molecules or ions, are arranged in a highly ordered microscopic structure, forming a crystal lattice that extends in all directions.

label: water ice crystal
definition: A crystal which is primarily composed of water ice.

label: hair ice
definition: A type of water ice that forms on dead wood with the assistance of the fungus Exidiopsis effusa and takes the shape of fine, silky hair.

label: clathrate material
definition: A material which is primarily composed of a substance arranged as a lattice which can trap or contain other molecules.

label: methane clathrate
definition: A clathrate material in which a large amount of methane is trapped within a crystal structure of water, forming a solid similar to ice.

label: hailfall
definition: Hailfall is a hydrological process in which balls or irregular lumps of water ice formed in thunderstorm or cumulonimbus clouds fall to a planetary surface.

label: precipitation process
definition: A precipitation process is a process in which a portion of some substance segregates from a material in which that substance or its precursors were dissolved or suspended in and settles due to a force such as gravity or centrifugal force.

label: storm
definition: A storm is an environmental process in which an environmental system and the processes it participates in are strongly perturbed by external forcings. These forcings typically increase the rates of processes unfolding in the system, relative to their normal rates.

label: atmospheric storm
definition: An atmospheric storm is a process in which a portion of an astronomical body's atmosphere is strongly perturbed from its prevaling weather.

label: hailstorm
definition: An atmospheric storm which intense hailfall occurs.

label: snowstorm
definition: An atmospheric storm during which intense snowfall occurs.

label: icestorm
definition: An atmospheric storm during which freezing rain falls and accumulates as ice on exposed surfaces.

label: area of lichen-dominated vegetation
definition: An area of a planet's surface which is primarily covered by fruticose or foliose lichens and which is in contact with an atmospheric column extending from the planetary boundary layer to the planet's exosphere with little to no physical obstruction.

label: snowfall
definition: A hydrological process in which irregular aggregates of snow fall to a planetary surface.

label: freezing rainfall
definition: Rainfall which occurs when the temperature of a planetary surface and its surrounding atmosphere are below the freezing point of water, resulting in supercooled raindrops which freeze upon impact with solid surfaces.

label: blizzard
definition: A blizzard is a severe snowstorm during which snowfall is transported by strong winds, sustained for several hours.

label: cloud condensation nucleus
definition: A solid or liquid particle, usually 0.2 micrometers in diameter, on which water vapour condenses, seeding cloud formation.

label: ice ablation zone
definition: An environmental zone which overlaps a glacier or an ice sheet, and in which ice loss exceeds ice gain.

label: ice loss process
definition: A material decumulation process during which the mass of an existing ice mass decreases in size.

label: ice calving process
definition: A process during which a part of an ice mass breaks away from the main mass.

label: glacial ice ablation process
definition: An ice loss process which occurs in the low-altitude area of a glacier or ice sheet below the firn layer.

label: water ice sublimation process
definition: A sublimation process during which water ice transitions into a gaseous state.

label: ecological corridor
definition: An ecosystem which bridges two or more adjoining ecosystems and through which organisms may move or propagate.

label: migration path
definition: An ecological corridor through which organisms move during a migration process.

label: planetary subsurface zone
definition: Regions of a planet which are not exposed to the planet's atmosphere or space, often comprising parts of one or more planetary structural layers.

label: ecotone
definition: An envirommental system which bridges two or more biomes and which includes ecological communities which blend these biomes' phylogenetic and phenotypic compositions.

label: water ice formation process
definition: A material transformation process during which water ice is formed.

label: natural environment
definition: An environmental system in which minimal to no anthropisation has occurred and non-human agents are the primary determinants of the system's dynamics and composition.

label: tree line ecotone
definition: An ecotone which overlaps at least one biome which supports the growth and persistence of trees and at least one that does not. Before ceasing altogether, tree growth becomes sparse and trees appear stunted as conditions become less favourable along this ecotone.

label: mass liquid flow
definition: A process whereby a volume of liquid moves due to a disequilibrium of physical forces.

label: water flow process
definition: A process during which a volume of water is transported due to a disequilibria in physical forces.

label: manufacturing process
definition: A planned process during which raw or recycled materials are transformed into products for use or sale using labour and machines, tools, chemical and biological processing, or formulation.

label: human-directed construction process
definition: An process during which natural or manufactured materials and products are processed and arranged by humans or their technology into structures.

label: groundwater
definition: Underground water which is located in pore spaces found in rock or unconsolidated deposits such as soil, clay, or gravel.

label: meteor
definition: A meteor is any matter- or energy-based entity which is located in the atmosphere of an astronomical body.

label: hypersaline water environment
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by hypersaline water.

label: tectonic movement
definition: A process during which pieces of a planetary crust and uppermost mantle move.

label: divergent tectonic movement
definition: A process during which pieces of a planetary crust and uppermost mantle move away from one another.

label: tectonic plate
definition: A part of a lithosphere which is separated by other such parts by geographic faults or similar geomorphological discontinuities.

label: tectonic plate boundary
definition: A geomorphological feature which is formed where two or more tectonic plates move towards, away from, or along one another, resulting in deformation of the lithosphere.

label: divergent plate boundary
definition: A geomorphological feature which is formed where two or more tectonic plates are actively moving away from one another, resulting in deformation of the lithosphere that forms rifts or ridges.

label: detritus
definition: An organic material which is primarily composed of dead particulate matter.

label: rift zone
definition: A compound astronomical body part in which extensional tectonic processes occur and where the lithosphere is being pulled apart.

label: ecosystem
definition: An environmental system which includes both living and non-living components.

label: ice
definition: An ice is an environmental material which is either frozen or which is maintained in a solid state by gravitational forces or pressure.

label: geodiversity
definition: A quality which inheres in a astronomical body or astronomical body part by virtue of the variation in its material composition, participation in geological processes, and the variation in is land- and hydroforms.

label: water surface
definition: The surface layer of a volume of water.

label: terrestrial environmental zone
definition: An environmental zone which is bounded by material parts of a land mass or the atmosphere or space adjacent to it.

label: marine environmental zone
definition: An environmental zone which is bounded by material parts of a marine environment.

label: wetland ecosystem
definition: A terrestrial ecosystem which is inundated or saturated by surface or ground water at a frequency and duration sufficient to support, and that under normal circumstances does support, a prevalence of vegetation typically adapted for life in saturated soil conditions.

label: canopy
definition: A vegetation layer which is formed by a collection of individual plant crowns, themselves constituting part of the aboveground portion of a plant community.

label: forest ecosystem
definition: An ecosystem which is determined by communities of plants with a tree growth form and in which members of those communities form continuous or discontinuous regions of canopy cover.

label: liquid layer
definition: A layer which is primarily composed of some liquid material.

label: material isosurface
definition: A layer throughout which one or more qualities (e.g. pressure, temperature, velocity, density) maintain an approximately constant value.

label: solid layer
definition: A layer which is primarily composed of some solid material, allowing for non-solid parts such as interstitial pockets of gas or liquid.

label: water ice layer
definition: A solid layer which is primarily composed of some water-based ice.

label: aquatic estuarine layer
definition: A layer of liquid that is part of an estuary.

label: environmental role
definition: A role which is may be realised by an environmental system

label: vegetated area
definition: A vegetated area is a geographic feature which has ground cover dominated by plant communities.

label: hydroform
definition: A geographic feature which is primarily composed of a continuous volume of liquid water held in shape or sustained by an environmental process.

label: liquid surface layer
definition: A surface layer which is composed primarily of some liquid.

label: solid surface layer
definition: A surface layer which is composed primarily of solid environmental material.

label: nitrogen cycling
definition: A biogeochemical cycle which has nitrogen-bearing chemical entities as participants.

label: sulfur cycling
definition: A biogeochemical cycle which has sulfur-bearing chemical entities as participants.

label: phosphorous cycling
definition: A biogeochemical cycle which has phosphorous-bearing chemical entities as participants.

label: advective transport process
definition: A material transport process during which a volume of material is displaced due to a disequilibrium in physical forces and during which 1) the qualities that inhere in that volume and 2) the processes that are unfolding within it are largely unchanged.

label: floating ice mass
definition: An ice mass which is suspended in a water body, being sufficiently buoyant for part of the mass to breach the surface of that water body.

label: erosion
definition: An action of exogenic processes (such as water flow or wind) which remove environmental material from one location on the surface of an astronomical body, transporting it to another location where it is deposited.

label: material decumulation zone
definition: A zone in which processes resulting in the removal of one or more environmental materials have higher rates than pocesses which result in their deposition and accumulation.

label: ice decumulation zone
definition: A material decumulation zone in which the rates of ice formation processes are below those of ice decumulation processes, leading to a net decrease in some mass of ice.

label: climate system
definition: A system which consists of an atmosphere, hydrosphere, cryosphere, land surface, and  biosphere, forced or influenced by external processes.

label: tundra ecosystem
definition: An ecosystem which 1) typically has monthly average temperatures below 10 degrees Celsius 2) has a low evapotranspiration ratio 3) is dominated by treeless terrain, covered by communities of low-growing vegetation such as dwarf shrubs, sedges and grasses, mosses, and lichens, 4) contains areas of soil underlain by permafrost with a thin active layer and 5) occurs in both polar and alpine regions (i.e., both high latitudes and high altitudes), and 5) does not have permanent snow or ice cover.

label: alpine tundra ecosystem
definition: A tundra ecosystem which exists at high altitudes and where vegetation is stunted due to low temperatures and high winds.

label: marine bed
definition: A bed which underlies a marine water body.

label: water-based cloud
definition: A cloud which is primarily composed of water-based aerosols.

label: polar mountain
definition: A mountain that is part of a polar environment.

label: liquid astronomical body part
definition: A part of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of a continuous volume of liquid material, shaped by one or more environmental processes.

label: gaseous astronomical body part
definition: A part of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of a continuous volume of gaseous material, shaped by one or more environmental processes.

label: fluid astronomical body part
definition: A part of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of a continuous volume of liquid or gaseous material, shaped by one or more environmental processes.

label: surface of an astronomical body
definition: A surface layer where the solid or liquid material of an astronomical body comes into contact with an atmosphere or outer space.

label: flattened elevation
definition: An elevation which is flattened across its highest surface.

label: alpine tundra biome
definition: A tundra biome which exists at high altitudes and where vegetation - dominated by a few species of dwarf shrubs, a few grasses, sedges, lichens, and mosses - is stunted due to low temperatures and high winds.

label: material congelation process
definition: A material transformation process during which a material's viscosity increase either through a reduction in temperature, through chemical reactions, or other physical effects.

label: drift ice mass
definition: A floating mass of ice which is 1) unattached to land or land-fast ice and 2) moved by the action of winds or currents.

label: fast ice
definition: A mass of sea ice which 1) is less than 2 meters in thickness and 2) forms along the coast, where it is attached to the shore, to an ice wall, to an ice front, or between shoals or grounded icebergs.

label: frazil
definition: Small, needle-like (spicules), plate-like, or discoid crystals derived from nearly pure fresh water, suspended in a water body.

label: frozen land
definition: Land which is below the freezing point of water.

label: frozen soil
definition: Soil which is below the freezing point of water.

label: mass ice flow
definition: An advective transport process during which a mass of ice is transported from one location to another.

label: tabular iceberg
definition: An iceberg which 1) has a flat upper surface, 2) is derived from an ice shelf, ice tongue, or floating tidewater glacier via detachment.

label: floeberg
definition: An ice mass which is composed of a large amount of sea ice in the form of a hummock or a group of such hummocks, frozen together and separated from any surrounding ice by sea water.

label: sea ice hummock
definition: An elevation which is formed by pressure at the point of contact between ice floes, resulting in a conglomeration of broken ice.

label: frost-formed hummock
definition: A hummock which is primarily composed of soil that has been pushed up by frost action.

label: iceberg
definition: An ice mass which has broken away from a larger ice mass on land, such as a glacier or ice shelf, and may be either afloat or aground.

label: land ice mass
definition: An ice mass which has formed over land.

label: freezing
definition: A material congelation process during which a liquid turns into a solid when its temperature is lowered below its melting point.

label: freezing of water into water ice
definition: A freezing process during which liquid water is transformed into water ice.

label: sea-ice lead
definition: An ice lead which occurs in a marine water body and is bounded by sea ice.

label: ice lead
definition: A surface layer of a water body which has been formed as the result of surface ice fracturing and moving apart.

label: flaw lead
definition: An ice lead between a mass of fast ice and a mass of pack ice.

label: shore lead
definition: An ice lead which occurs between the shore and pack ice.

label: surface layer of a water body
definition: A water surface that is part of a water body.

label: frozen lead
definition: An ice lead within which new, nilas, and young ice has formed.

label: pack ice mass
definition: A drift ice mass which has an ice concentration above or equal to 7/10: which covers 70% or more of a given area of a water body.

label: water-body-derived ice
definition: Ice which has formed as the result of freezing of water which was part of a water body.

label: cryopeg
definition: A layer which is composed of ground that 1) remains unfrozen due to increased solute concentration and 2) is present within a mass of permafrost.

label: protected area
definition: An environmental zone which 1) contains ecosystems, constructed features, or other entities deemed to be of natural, historical, cultural, or other significance and 2) has been afforded legal protections restricting one or more forms of use by a competent authority.

label: frost heave
definition: An elevation which is formed as an ice mass forms under soil, resulting in upwards deformation of the land surface.

label: water current
definition: A hydroform which is maintained by a continuous, directed movement of water, generated by disequilibria in a water mass.

label: cryospheric layer
definition: A layer which is part of a cryosphere.

label: active layer in a cryosphere
definition: A layer of environmental material which is subject to freeze-thaw cycles.

label: thawing process
definition: A warming process during which the thermal energy in a portion of environmental material is sufficient to melt water-based ice or snow.

label: material warming process
definition: A process during which the temperature of a portion of environmental material is increased, along with the kinetic energy of its constituent molecules.

label: permafrost thawing process
definition: A thawing process during which permafrost is warmed beyond the melting point of water-based ice, snow, or other forms of solid water.

label: snow accumulation process
definition: A material accumulation process during which the mass of snow on a surface increases.

label: ice accumulation process
definition: A material accumulation process during which ice forms in an environmental material or an existing accumulation of ice increases in mass.

label: englacial
definition: A positional quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer being located within a glacier or ice sheet, between their summer surface or bed.

label: glaciation
definition: An interval of time within an ice age and during which temperatures fall resulting in planet-wide glacier advances.

label: interglacial
definition: An interval of time within an ice age and during which temperatures rise and result in planet-wide glacier retreat.

label: ice age
definition: A temporal interval during which a planet's surface and atmospheric temperatures fall, resulting in the presence or expansion of continental and polar ice sheets or alpine glaciers.

label: frost action process
definition: A material transport process during which alternate freezing and thawing of moisture in soil, rock and other materials results  modifications of those materials and in the formation of structures on, or in, the ground.

label: cryoturbation of soil
definition: A frost action process during which soil is displaced.

label: soil cryoturbate
definition: A mass of soil moved or disturbed by frost action.

label: fluid surface layer
definition: A surface layer which is composed primarily of some liquid or gas.

label: lysocline
definition: A cline across which one or more solid environmental materials dissolve into their surrounding fluid.

label: nutricline
definition: A cline across which nutrient content of a fluid changes rapidly.

label: fluid interface layer
definition: A surface layer which separates two portions of fluid with respect to either 1) a discontinuity of some fluid property or 2) some derivative of one of these properties in a direction normal to the interface.

label: fluid layer
definition: A layer which is composed primarily of some fluid.

label: fluid front
definition: A fluid interface which separates two fluid masses with differing properties.

label: weather front
definition: A gaseous front which separates two masses of air with different densities and is a principal cause of meteorological phenomena.

label: air mass
definition: An object which is composed of a continuous mass of air.

label: interface layer
definition: A layer which separates two portions of environmental material which possess 1) differing compositions, 2) a discontinuity of some property, or 3) some derivative of some property in a direction normal to the interface.

label: mass of environmental material
definition: An object which is composed primarily of an environmental material

label: mass of fluid
definition: An object which is composed primarily of a fluid.

label: mass of liquid
definition: An object which is composed primarily of a liquid.

label: mass of compounded environmental materials
definition: An mass of environmental materials which has appreciable quantities of several individual materials, such that the removal of one would convert the mass into a different entity.

label: isohaline surface
definition: A material isosurface within which salinity is approximately constant.

label: isopycnal surface
definition: A material isosurface within which density is approximately constant.

label: isothermal surface
definition: A material isosurface within which temperature is approximately constant.

label: polar front
definition: A weather front which separates air masses of tropical and polar origin.

label: katabatic wind
definition: An atmospheric wind during which cold atmospheric gas flows downwards towards the surface of an astronomical body.

label: downslope katabatic wind
definition: A katabatic wind during which atmospheric gas flows down the slope of an elevation, typically during periods of light larger-scale winds.

label: drainage wind
definition: A downslope katabatic wind which is generated by the cooling of atmospheric gas in contact with terrain surfaces.

label: glacier wind
definition: A drainage wind which flows along the icy surface of a glacier.

label: cyclonic circulation
definition: A mass fluid flow which moves  in the same direction as a planet's rotation, rotating due to a Coriolis effect.

label: subsurface zone of an astronomical body
definition: An environmental zone which includes those regions of an astronomical body which are not exposed to its atmosphere or space.

label: landmass
definition: A large continuous area of land, either surrounded by sea or contiguous with another landmass.

label: compound astronomical body part
definition: A part of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of a continuous medium bearing liquid, gaseous, and solid material in varying quantities.

label: land
definition: A surface layer of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of solid material and is not covered by oceans or other bodies of water.

label: ecosystem process
definition: An environmental process either driven by or primarily impacting the parts or emergent properties of an ecosystem.

label: organic object
definition: An object which is formed as a result of one or more biological processes and is composed primarily of organic material.

label: siliceous ooze
definition: Siliceous ooze is a marine sediment composed of the debris of plankton with silica shells, such as diatoms and radiolaria. This ooze is limited to areas with high biological productivity, such as the polar oceans, and upwelling zones near the equator. The least common type of sediment, it covers only 15% of the ocean floor. It accumulates at a slower rate than calcareous ooze: 0.2-1 cm / 1000 yr.

label: coastal water body
definition: Coastal water is a marine water body bordering a coast.

label: fluid environmental material
definition: A liquid or a gas.

label: environmental system process
definition: A process in which includes the components of an environmental system as participants.

label: atmospheric process
definition: A process which occurs within an atmosphere.

label: greenhouse effect
definition: A process by which thermal radiation from a planetary surface is absorbed by atmospheric greenhouse gases, and is re-radiated in all directions. Since part of this re-radiation is back towards the surface and the lower atmosphere, it results in an elevation of the average surface temperature above what it would be in the absence of the gases.

label: ecosystem-wide photosynthesis
definition: A process which consists of all photosynthesis processes instantiated in an ecosystem.

label: ecosystem-wide respiration
definition: A process which consists of all respiration processes instantiated in an ecosystem.

label: biogeochemical cycling
definition: A biogeochemical process during which one or more chemical compounds are sequentially converted into a series of related compounds in a regularly repeating, periodic fashion.

label: carbon cycling
definition: A biogeochemical cycle which has carbon-bearing chemical entities as participants.

label: algal bloom process
definition: A process during which the populations in a community of algae in a marine or freshwater ecosystem undergo rapid growth, resulting in high concentrations of algal cells that occur only periodically and briefly in that ecosystem, relative to their concentrations through the majority of the planetary orbital period.

label: planetary erosion
definition: An action of exogenic processes (such as water flow or wind) which remove environmental material from one part of a planet's crust, transporting it to another location where it is deposited.

label: biogeochemical process
definition: A process during which chemicals that are involved in natural ecosystem processes are transported or transformed, and which impact the activity of biological entities

label: environmental pollution
definition: An environmental system process that results in the introduction of contaminants into an environment.

label: air pollution
definition: A pollution process during which particulates or other contaminants are released into a portion of air.

label: soil pollution
definition: A pollution process during which contaminants are released into soil.

label: water pollution
definition: A pollution process during which contaminants are released into water.

label: plastic pollution
definition: A pollution process during which plastic contaminants are released into an environmental material.

label: pollution monitoring
definition: A monitoring process that assays the level of environmental pollutants to determine the presence of effect of environmental pollution.

label: neve
